data.title: What is amoebic dysentery?
data.normalized_content: Amoebic dysentery is an intestinal infection caused by the invasion of the parasite Entamoeba histolytica. The disease can lead to diarrhea, nausea, fever and acute abdominal pain, and in many cases there are unclear symptoms. Anyone can get amoebic dysentery. The most common areas where this occurs are tropical regions with unsanitary conditions, such as: Unclean bathrooms Unhygienic areas and hand-washing facilities Unhygienic wastewater treatment Amoebic dysentery is an intestinal infection that occurs due to unsanitary conditions
data.content: Lỵ amip là tình trạng nhiễm trùng đường ruột, xảy ra do sự xâm nhập của ký sinh trùng Entamoeba histolytica. Bệnh có thể dẫn đến tiêu chảy, buồn nôn, sốt và đau bụng cấp, nhiều trường hợp còn xuất hiện với triệu chứng không rõ ràng. Bất kỳ ai cũng có thể mắc lỵ amip. Trong đó, khu vực xảy ra phổ biến nhất là những vùng nhiệt đới có điều kiện vệ sinh không đảm bảo, chẳng hạn như: Phòng vệ sinh không sạch Khu vực, vật dụng rửa tay không đảm bảo vệ sinh Xử lý nước thải không đúng cách Lỵ amip là bệnh nhiễm trùng đường ruột xảy ra do điều kiện vệ sinh không đảm bảo

data.title: amoeba life cycle | Amoebic dysentery
data.normalized_content: The group of protists always forms surrounding cysts to cope with harsh environmental conditions. In other words, this is an important part of their life cycle.(2) The agent that causes amoebic dysentery is the parasite Entamoeba histolytica. This type of protozoa forms cysts and passes out into the environment in feces. When food or water containing Entamoeba histolytica cysts enters the digestive tract, the amoeba is immediately released and the infection begins. During the active phase, Entamoeba histolytica exists only in the host and fresh feces. On the contrary, cysts are always present in water, soil, and food, especially in humid conditions. With a tough outer protective layer, this bacterial cyst can survive continuously for weeks, withstanding heat levels of up to 68 degrees Celsius for 5 minutes. In addition, Entamoeba histolytica is also resistant to certain chemicals. That is why amoebic dysentery is relatively difficult to control. Bacteria that attack the intestinal wall have the risk of causing serious damage. In many cases, it also enters the bloodstream, causing damage to the liver, lungs, brain and spleen. Anatomy of the bacterium Entamoeba histolytica
data.content: Nhóm sinh vật nguyên sinh luôn hình thành các bào nang xung quanh để chống chọi với điều kiện khắc nghiệt từ môi trường. Nói cách khác, đây là một phần quan trọng trong vòng đời của chúng.(2) Tác nhân gây ra bệnh lỵ amip chính là ký sinh trùng Entamoeba histolytica. Loại đơn bào này hình thành các bào nang và đi ra bên ngoài môi trường theo phân. Khi thức ăn hoặc nước chứa bào nang Entamoeba histolytica xâm nhập vào đường tiêu hóa, amip ngay lập tức sẽ được giải phóng và tiến hành quá trình lây nhiễm. Trong giai đoạn hoạt động, Entamoeba histolytica chỉ tồn tại trong vật chủ và phân tươi. Ngược lại, bào nang luôn có trong nước, đất, thực phẩm, đặc biệt là ở điều kiện ẩm ướt. Với lớp bảo vệ cứng cáp bên ngoài, bào nang vi khuẩn này có thể tồn tại liên tục trong nhiều tuần, chống chịu được mức nhiệt lên đến 68 độ C trong vòng 5 phút. Ngoài ra, Entamoeba histolytica còn có khả năng chống lại một số hóa chất nhất định. Đó là lý do tại sao bệnh lỵ amip tương đối khó kiểm soát. Vi khuẩn tấn công thành ruột có nguy cơ gây ra các tổn thương nghiêm trọng. Nhiều trường hợp còn xâm nhập vào máu, gây hại cho gan, phổi, não và lách. data.title: cause of amoebic dysentery
data.normalized_content: The cause of amoebic dysentery is the invasion of the parasite Entamoeba histolytica into the digestive system. Paths of infection include: (1) Eating food and drinks contaminated with parasites Touching a surface containing parasite eggs and then putting them in your mouth Contact with feces, most likely to occur when: having anal sex, living or traveling to places with unsanitary conditions...

data.title: symptoms of amoebic dysentery
data.normalized_content: Amoebic dysentery often does not manifest into specific symptoms, especially at the first infection. Patients may notice some of the following typical signs within 4 weeks of infection: Abdominal pain Diarrhea Rectal bleeding Fever Loose stools Nausea Entamoeba histolytica can exist in the intestine for a long time, even when there are no obvious symptoms. Therefore, immediately after living or moving to an area with unsanitary conditions, the best solution is to get examined and tested for timely detection. Time to onset varies widely between cases, and asymptomatic infection lasts on average more than a year. The study hypothesized that this change in intensity could be due to the amoeba strain, the host's immune response, or the bacteria or viruses involved. Diarrhea is one of the common symptoms of amoebic dysentery

Do đó, ngay sau khi sinh sống hoặc di chuyển đến khu vực có điều kiện vệ sinh không đảm bảo, giải pháp tốt nhất là nên thăm khám, xét nghiệm để phát hiện kịp thời.  Thời gian khởi phát ở các trường hợp thường rất khác nhau và nhiễm trùng không có triệu chứng trung bình kéo dài hơn một năm. data.title: Diagnosis method of amoebic dysentery
data.normalized_content: When suspecting a patient has amoebic dysentery, the doctor will initially ask about recent travel history and health status. After that, a number of tests may be ordered to make an accurate diagnosis, including: Stool test: Patients need to provide stool samples within a few days to screen for parasites. Blood tests: Blood tests help determine whether the infection has spread beyond the intestines and other organs. Once the parasites spread from the intestines, there is a high risk that they will no longer appear in the stool. Diagnostic imaging tests (ultrasound, CT scan): The main purpose is to check for lesions on the liver or spread to other organs in the abdomen and the whole body. Colonoscopy: Colonoscopy is performed to check for parasitic damage on the colon.

Sau đó, một số xét nghiệm có thể được chỉ định tiến hành để chẩn đoán chính xác, bao gồm:    Xét nghiệm phân: Người bệnh cần cung cấp mẫu phân trong vài ngày để sàng lọc ký sinh trùng.         Xét nghiệm máu: Xét nghiệm máu giúp xác định tình trạng lây lan nhiễm trùng ra ngoài ruột và các cơ quan khác. Ký sinh trùng khi lan ra khỏi ruột, nguy cơ cao sẽ không còn xuất hiện trong phân.         Xét nghiệm chẩn đoán hình ảnh (siêu âm, chụp CT): Mục đích chính là kiểm tra các tổn thương trên gan hay lây lan đến các cơ quan khác trong ổ bụng và toàn thân.         Nội soi đại tràng: Phương pháp nội soi đại tràng được thực hiện để kiểm tra tổn thương của ký sinh trùng trên đại tràng.

data.title: How to treat amoebic dysentery
data.normalized_content: Antibiotics are used to treat amoebic dysentery, and there are also medications to treat gastrointestinal symptoms. Patients need to see a doctor for appropriate treatment to avoid dangerous complications. Medication is the initial treatment solution for amoebiasis
data.content: Kháng sinh được dùng để điều trị bệnh lỵ amip, ngoài ra còn có các loại thuốc điều trị triệu chứng đường tiêu hóa. Người bệnh cần đến gặp bác sĩ để có điều trị phù hợp, tránh biến chứng nguy hiểm. Dùng thuốc là giải pháp điều trị ban đầu cho bệnh amip

data.title: How to prevent amoebic dysentery?
data.normalized_content: 1. Maintain personal hygiene. Practice good hand hygiene before handling or preparing food, eating and drinking, and after going to the toilet or handling feces. Wash hands with soap and water, rubbing for a few minutes. for at least 20 seconds, then rinse with clean water, dry with disposable paper towels or a specialized dryer. Clean your hands regularly with 70 - 80 degree alcohol. Stop all activities going to school, going to work, and going to medical clinics. Gastroenterology specialist as soon as unusual symptoms appear in the digestive tract, typically diarrhea 2. Maintain food hygiene Apply standard food handling formulas: Choose clean ingredients, always keep your hands clean and clean processing utensils, separate raw and cooked foods, cook thoroughly before eating, and store food at safe temperatures. Only drink boiled water or bottled water of guaranteed origin Avoid drinking iced drinks of unknown origin Isolate infected people or asymptomatic carriers from food preparation, child care, the elderly, immunocompromised people. Handle food properly to effectively prevent amoebic dysentery

data.title: Frequently asked questions about amoebic dysentery
data.normalized_content: Below are some useful answers related to amoebiasis that patients need to understand: 1. Is amoebic dysentery dangerous? Amoebic dysentery can be completely cured if treated properly. In the opposite case, this condition can lead to many dangerous complications, even death. Therefore, patients need to immediately contact a medical facility in case of doubt. 2. Is amoebiasis contagious? The Entamoeba histolytica parasite lives only in humans and is transmitted through fecal bacteria. The specific route of infection is as follows: Touching feces carrying pathogens and continuing contact with the mouth Eating food or water contaminated with parasites Oral-anal sex 3. If you have amoebic dysentery, you can go to school , go to work normally? All school and work activities should be stopped immediately when detecting amoebiasis. Along with that, patients should wash their hands thoroughly after using the toilet, bathroom or handling diapers and waste. It is important to discuss with your doctor about your health condition and when you can return to school or work after taking antibiotics. 4. What should you not eat with amoebic dysentery? People with amoebic dysentery should avoid drinking milk and dairy products of unknown origin, raw vegetables, cold or carbonated drinks. This needs to be maintained for several days until cleared by your doctor. Avoid eating sweets when suffering from amoebic dysentery. Dưới đây là môt số giải đáp hữu ích liên quan đến bệnh amip, người bệnh cần nắm rõ:

1. Bệnh lỵ amip có nguy hiểm không?

Bệnh lỵ amip hoàn toàn có thể chữa khỏi nếu điều trị đúng cách. Trong trường hợp ngược lại, tình trạng này có thể dẫn đến nhiều biến chứng nguy hiểm, thậm chí gây tử vong. Do đó, người bệnh cần liên hệ ngay với cơ sở y tế trong trường hợp nghi ngờ.

2. Bệnh amip có lây không?

Ký sinh trùng Entamoeba histolytica chỉ sống ở người và lây truyền qua phân vi khuẩn. Con đường lây nhiễm cụ thể như sau: Chạm vào phân mang mầm bệnh và tiếp tục tiếp xúc với miệng Ăn uống thực phẩm hoặc nước nhiễm ký sinh trùng Quan hệ tình dục miệng – hậu môn

3. Mắc bệnh lỵ amip có thể đi học, đi làm bình thường không?

Mọi hoạt động đi học và đi làm cần ngưng ngay lập tức khi phát hiện mắc bệnh amip. Đi kèm với đó, người bệnh nên rửa tay thật kỹ sau khi sử dụng nhà vệ sinh, phòng tắm hoặc xử lý tã, chất thải. Điều quan trọng là cần trao đổi với bác sĩ về tình trạng sức khỏe, thời điểm có thể quay trở lại đi học, đi làm sau khi dùng kháng sinh.

4. Lỵ amip không nên ăn gì?

Người mắc lỵ amip cần tránh uống sữa và các sản phẩm từ sữa không rõ nguồn gốc, rau sống, đồ uống lạnh hoặc có gas. Điều này cần được duy trì trong vài ngày cho đến khi bác sĩ cho phép.
